Text.Value: If Orpheus stands with us, it won't matter what the Emperor thinks.
If we free Orpheus, then it is to slay him. This was my promise - and you will not keep me from it.
Let the Emperor have his tantrum. If Orpheus stands with us, we can rid ourselves of the illithid.
Use the hammer. If the Emperor objects - for this, the hammer is also a solution.
If the githyanki is willing to help, we will have no need of the rogue illithid.
If you held a knife to my throat, I'd choose Orpheus over the Emperor. We'd be fools to trust an illithid.
Who cares what the illithid thinks. If we can get Orpheus on our side, we're golden.
The traitor prince is close. We must split him open; we must fulfil Vlaakith's command!
The Emperor's plan only failed because the brain evolved - let's hear it out. It might have a solution yet.
I'm not eager to unleash the orb - but if no other option presents itself...
Damn these stones. We did not come this far, spilled so much blood, just for them to fail us.
Those fucking stones were worthless.
The stones have failed us, and our enemy is more potent than ever. This feels like a step backwards.
After everything we went through to get those stones, they didn't even work? Because now it's a 'nethersomething'?
So now it is a Netherbrain we face - whatever in the howling hells that might be.
|Well, that didn't work.|
Wisely spoken. A ghaik acts only for its own aims - and we near the end of our usefulness.
We have never been true allies - just toys in its game.
Well-spoken, says Boo! If we are to die useless deaths, let them be useless deaths of our choosing.
It has toyed with us long enough - now is the time for action, not mere belief.
Agreed. We could scarcely find a worse figure to trust even if we tried.
I'm not sure I ever really did. That thing is in it for itself, all the way.
Trust me - unleashing the orb is not something I want to do, but if there's no other way...
...well, I shan't hesitate. We cannot allow this thing to prevail.
The Emperor will no doubt seek to pour honey in our ears - talk us round to it's way of thinking. It would be remiss of me to not remind all that there is another way...
*Discomfort gnaws at you like a rat in your belly - is it doubt? Or simply fear?*

EditorData.NodeContext: 'guest' = the tadpole living in your head.

Text.Value: Damn these stones. We did not come this far, spilled so much blood, just for them to fail us.
Those fucking stones were worthless.
So much for those stones. How're we supposed defeat a Netherbrain?
After everything we went through to get those stones, they didn't even work? Because now it's a 'nethersomething'?
So now it is a Netherbrain we face - and it seems disinclined to yield to the Netherstones.
I do not know what a Netherbrain is - but these Netherstones would have been more useful fashioned into a nether-club.
The stones have failed us. What in nature's realm could possibly best a Netherbrain?
|Well, that didn't work.|
Agreed. Nothing's lost yet but a bit of our sanity. Onward.
As you wish. Minsc will listen - but Boo will watch.
True. I don't exactly trust it, but it might be the only hope we have.
Optimistic to the end - good. Cynicism won't help us now. Let's hear the Emperor out.
The flayer makes a great show of having all the answers. Let us see if it can save its own skin.
Hear him out if you wish - but please, don't act in haste.
We can make up our minds after we hear what the Emperor has to say.
The Emperor will no doubt seek to pour honey in our ears - talk us round to it's way of thinking. It would be remiss of me to not remind all that there is another way...
I will not let the prince suffer another moment in this infernal prison!
I won't accept that. You cannot be so desperate as to believe the only answer is destruction.
Too great. I won't allow it, soldier.
I'd rather you didn't, not until we've exhausted all other options.
Surely we're not there yet? There must still be options that don't include exploding.
A grim choice. But perhaps better than none at all, at the last.
It would be amusing to see you explode, Gale. But Minsc would rather we all die with swords in our hands and spells on our lips.
It is too great a cost. What salvation would that be, if paid for with the blood of our allies?
You would bring us down with you? This is a coward's choice. Everything bleeds, the brain included, we just need to find where to strike it.
I expect not. Which is why we will split the ghaik open and let his silver blood spill.
You're completely serious about this?
The Emperor will no doubt seek to pour honey in our ears - talk us round to it's way of thinking. It would be remiss of me to not remind all that there is another way...
'When our allies fail us, we must turn to our enemies.' My father's words. Where the Emperor's concerned, I fear we've no choice but to trust.
Aye. And that at the end of it all, there's a sunset with our names on it.
At this stage, I'll agree to just about anything.
Personally I'll take anything that helps us survive. I just hope that's still an option.
Wise. Even a treacherous path is better than blundering through the wilderness.
Boo is with you until the very end. And Minsc will always be with Boo.
The outlook is dire. Any choice is better than no choice, I say.
'open' to it? On the precipice of annihilation, I should hope you're actively searching for a solution, not just waiting for one to fall on your lap.
|Always good to be flexible.|
Sounds pretty drastic. What about the Emperor? It might have another trick up its sleeve...?
What about the illithid? Boo would not like to see the city destroyed. Minsc neither.
What about our old friend, the illithid? Might it not have a less destructive alternative?
I would much prefer we find another way. Perhaps the mind flayer has another idea?
It should not have to come to that. Perhaps the illithid can provide us with a better solution.
Then we better be sure the githyanki prince will stand with us.
We better be totally sure he's on our side, then. Things are bound to get ugly fast if we let him out.
We can only hope he indeed proves to be an ally...
Perhaps. But if he can't, we may be up the proverbial creek.
Quite a moment to try and make new friends. But it seems we are out of other options.
Do it! If he will not help, Boo will make him long for the safety of his prison once more.
Much would rest on Orpheus proving himself an ally, then.
You're making quite a habit of freeing prisoners. I hope this one doesn't disappoint you.
|I don't know about you, but I wouldn't be so pleased being woken up after an eternity of prison time.|
I won't accept that. You cannot be so desperate as to believe the only answer is destruction.
Let that be our backup plan's backup plan. We need you, beardy. Un-exploded.
No - I won't hear of it. Not until we know there's absolutely no other way.
Surely we're not there yet? There must still be options that don't include exploding.
Fire might cleanse the wood-rot - but to little end, if you must burn down the forest entire.
My hamster is not in the habit of choosing between two evils. We will find a better way, or Boo will know the reason why!
No, we cannot resort to that - not if there's even a glimmer of hope remaining. If we're willing to sacrifice a whole city of innocents, what are we even fighting for?
Of course - I've had ample time to think on it. We may yet prevail by other means... but the option remains. And I shall not hesitate, if called upon.
... the orb. I still have the means to unleash its power, and put a stop to all this from one heartbeat to the next. But it would not be without cost. The city, and all who remain, would be lost.
I made my promise. I will not fail my queen on the basis of groundless fears or fickle whims.
Let's talk to the Emperor first before we decide anything.
We may cling to hope a while longer if you wish, but should that fail us, I'll be ready to act.
... the orb. I still have the means to unleash its power, and put a stop to all this from one heartbeat to the next. But it would not be without cost. The city, and all who remain, would be lost.
Watch your tone. I will do what's right, no more and no less.
It's a high cost - but we may have no choice but to pay it.
Can there be no better way? The mind flayer may have manipulated us, but let's not let it rob us of each other.
Mm. No. Boo likes neither option - you will simply have to try harder, wizard.
A small price to pay for the destruction of the Netherbrain.
That's a drastic solution to say the least... but what other choice do we have? Fight a losing fight? Trust the Emperor?
Not a price I really want to pay, but if we run out of options, we might have to fork up.
'When our allies fail us, we must turn to our enemies.' My father's words. Where the Emperor's concerned, I fear we've no choice but to trust.
Then we make our own way. Starting now.
I'm glad you still think we have the luxury of being picky. Let's just hope another option presents itself...
I'm not saying you're wrong, I just hope there's another way.
We need not speak of trust. Only using the creature as it no doubt means to use us.
Well-spoken, says Boo! If we are to die useless deaths, let them be useless deaths of our choosing.
Alternatives are slow to present themselves... yet we must hold out hope.
You keep your trust well-guarded. Let us hope you do not lose the key - we may yet have need of it. If it comes to that.
|Fair enough, lead the way.|
Do what you must. But I'd sooner butcher the ghaik than entertain its lies.
I will keep an open mind. But I will split the illithid's head at the first sign of danger.
Fine. Minsc will listen. But Boo will watch.
Its goal ends with the brain, but ours must span the distance beyond. When we commit, and we will commit, we shall do it with intention. Our design, no other.
Humour that thing if you must - just as long as you're ready to cut it down to size if it shows any sign of betraying us.
Hear, hear. Still hoping for a miracle, but I'm ready for whatever comes our way.
Why in the hells would we do that?!
*The stones were supposed to allow you to dominate the brain - the Emperor said so. But it didn't work.*
Old tentacle-head won't like that. Who knows how it'll react.
The illithid will object. But Minsc and Boo will be very persuasive.
The mind flayer won't like that. If we take that road, we'd better be very, very sure it's the right one.
Such an action could turn the Emperor from ally to foe...
The Emperor fears Orpheus. Do not expect it to stand idly by and see him freed.
Trust the Emperor, or annihilate the Sword Coast. A vexing choice - but an easy one.
These can't be our only options. Destroy the Sword Coast, or trust the mind flayer?!
| So our choices are: Trust the scheming mindflayer or Disintegrate the Sword Coast... |
| So our choices are: Trust the scheming mindflayer or Disintegrate the Sword Coast... |
| So our choices are: Trust the scheming mindflayer or Disintegrate the Sword Coast... |
| So our choices are: Trust the scheming mindflayer or Disintegrate the Sword Coast... |
The orb is not a choice that I relish... but it is not one we can afford to ignore.
Whatever the Emperor has to say, I'm past the point of trusting it.
I have your back. We will slay Orpheus.
'When our allies fail us, we must turn to our enemies.' My father's words. Where the Emperor's concerned, I fear we've no choice but to trust.
Right. Let's see what old worm-tongue has to say.
Fine. Let's hear the illithid out.
Well then, let's hear it out.
Wise. Even a treacherous path is better than blundering through the wilderness.
Boo will listen, for his is the only mind worth heeding!
An unnatural and unlikely saviour. Yet needs must...
If it has anything valuable to say, then we may act upon it. Until then, our eyes and ears must remain open for any other possibility of success.
|At least he seems to enjoy chatting more than brain eating.|
I will find a way. Vlaakith will not be denied!
So it must be. Vlaakith demands we sever the prince's blasphemous head.
Yet I see no other options. Deceitful he may be - but our best hopes lie with him.
As far as I'm concerned, it's proven it knows more than we do. We ought to hear it out.
Yet other options are hard to come by. We owe the Emperor our lives, at least.
It's proven it can save our lives. Again. But sure, cut that safety rope. What's the worst that could happen?
Trust was never the foundation of the arrangement. Only shared survival - and that holds truer than ever.
Few other paths remain. Perhaps it isn't wise to shun the one who just saved us - even an illithid.
Boo's stomach already bloats from the lies we have been fed. There will be no second serving!
|Then that will not leave us with many options left. Measure twice, cut once.|
Then you will make him your concern.
Fine, hear it out if you must. But I'd sooner butcher the ghaik than entertain more of its lies.
Then talk to it, and I will keep an open mind. But I'm splitting open the illithid's head at the first sign of danger.
As you wish. Minsc will listen - but Boo will watch.
If this plan is anything short of a strategic masterpiece, we shall have no recourse to follow it.
Humour that thing if you must - just as long as you're ready to cut it down to size if it shows any sign of betraying us.
I'm willing to hear this so-called plan. Also willing to split the thing's skull open, but I can wait.
Do this, and the queen's forces will aid us against the Netherbrain.
As keen as I am to survive, the option remains - and we have vanishingly few others. I daresay none.
Without the Orphic Hammer, we may not be able to reach the prince, let alone kill him.

EditorData.logicalname: KNOWS ABOUT HAMMER VLAAKITH PATH W/O HAMMER, knows of hammer

Text.Value: I have your back. We will liberate Orpheus.
I will find a way. The prince mustn't suffer another moment in this infernal prison!
Look at Gale, look down to his chest.
Death. We will butcher the ghaik, and free Orpheus from its grasp. Gith's Heir will rise once more!
How would we free Orpheus? His cage is unbreakable.

EditorData.logicalname: ORPHEUS PATH W/O HAMMER, knows of hammer

Text.Value: Speak to the Emperor, entertain its tall tales if it suits you.
Are you sure about this?
Our time is running out. We need to act.
We need to do something soon, don't we.
Time's short - we need to act, one way or another.
Whatever we do, we need to do it quick. Time is not on our side.
Better to act swiftly than stand around and wonder.
We must act now - Boo is afraid, and I cannot stand to feel his quivering!
Time is not on our side. We need a course of action - now.
We need a strategy. And we need it now.
|So we're going to need to place our pieces on the board, so to speak.|
*If only you could free Orpheus, perhaps he could help you succeed where the Emperor failed?*
Let's not rush to conclusions - we should at least hear what the Emperor has to say.
Let's hear the Emperor out. We can make our minds up then.
*There is another way - the hammer that will free Orpheus. Perhaps the githyanki could help you succeed, where the mind flayer failed?*
The Netherstones failed, the brain still lives. Orpheus is hardly my top concern.
Gith's Heir will rise once more!
The Emperor is a ghaik! It acts on its own whims - it is no friend to us.
I would think twice before trusting the illithid. It is loyal for only as long as we're useful.
The Emperor would have flayed Minsc's mind already if there were a mind to flay! It cannot be trusted.
The mind flayer has been manipulating us - if we listen to it, we are no better than the thralls we fight.
The Emperor likely saved us because it needs us as pawns - we can't trust it.
Don't be daft. The Emperor misled us. Planned this whole thing. What's it hiding?
It's a high cost - but we may have no choice but to pay it.
I won't accept it. I won't.
If it allows us to circumvent the illithid's mind-games and defy the brain, it may be our best chance of freedom.
That's a drastic solution to say the least... but what other choice do we have? Fight a losing fight? Trust the Emperor?
I don't like it, but if it comes to that, I suppose... we have it as an option.
| I won't accept it. I won't. |
The Emperor will resist. It will lie, it will cajole - it might even beg. But there is only one answer it deserves:
Let's hope the Emperor has a better plan.
If you must. But I'd sooner butcher the ghaik than entertain its lies.
I will keep an open mind. But I will split the illithid's head at the first sign of danger.
Boo will listen, for his is the only mind worth heeding!
We listen, and we ready our weapons. If its tongue veers a lick from truth, we cut it out.
Humour that thing if you must - just as long as you're ready to cut it down to size if it shows any sign of betraying us.
That's it. Get the facts, then sort them out. Not like we have much of a choice to do otherwise.
Shoot Gale a meaningful glance.
I see no other options. Deceitful the illithid may be - but our best hopes lie with it.
That's it. Get the facts, then sort them out. Not like we have much of a choice to do otherwise.
As much as I hate to admit it, we're hardly drowning in better options. Let's see what it has to say for itself, I suppose.
True, hearing it out won't kill us. It's one of the few things that won't.
Wise. Even a treacherous path is better than blundering through the wilderness.
|Best to make such decisions after thorough research.|
Hammer or not, Vlaakith will not be denied!
I doubt the Emperor will take too kindly to that.
Old tentacle-head won't like that. Who knows how it'll react.
May work - or may just make an enemy of the Emperor. And we're hardly short of those as it is.
The mind flayer won't like that. If we take that road, we'd better be very, very sure it's the right one.
The Emperor fears Orpheus. Do not expect it to stand idly by and see him freed.
If the illithid objects, Minsc and Boo will tear off his tentacles.
Such an action could turn the Emperor from ally to foe...
|Nothing like a good one-two with a blunt object to shift negotiations, though it doesn't seem like the type to appreciate such crude methods.|
Without the Orphic Hammer, we may not be able to free the prince.

EditorData.logicalname: KNOWS ABOUT HAMMER - ORPHEUS PATH W/O HAMMER, knows of hammer

Text.Value: If we free Orpheus, then it is to slay him. This was my promise - and you will not keep me from it.
If Orpheus stands with us, it won't matter what the Emperor thinks.
Let the Emperor have his tantrum. If Orpheus stands with us, we can rid ourselves of the illithid.
Use the hammer. If the Emperor objects - for this, the hammer is also a solution.
Now is not to concern ourselves with the feelings of an illithid, if it is even capable of them. If Orpheus presents a solution, we take it, we survive.
If you held a knife to my throat, I'd choose Orpheus over the Emperor. We'd be fools to trust an illithid.
Who cares what squiddie thinks? Our goal was never to save the damn thing. If Orpheus can help us, we should give him a chance.
I would not normally hang my fate on something so flimsy as hope - but our options are few.
Hope. The word of the hour.
Hope isn't the most robust of plans - but I see few alternatives.
Let's hope.
Hope alone will not claw us out of this hole. We must get to climbing.
Hope is a fine thing, my friend - but even my hamster thinks we will be needing something more.
Hope is a slender branch to cling to - but few other options remain.
Hope? Hope is for the weak.
|Hope wasn't very effective, given we're now here.|
We have another option - the orb. I could still put a stop to this... though at great cost.
Present company excluded of course - but the point remains. We cannot afford to trust your kin will react well to us.
Yet we live. And we have the Emperor to thank for it.
Still, we're closer than we've ever been to finishing this thing. And we got here with the Emperor's help.
I guess it could be worse. At least we're still alive. I suppose we owe the Emperor some thanks for that...
I hate to say it, but thank the hells for that mind flayer. If it hadn't pulled us out of there...
But we are not dead yet, thanks to our illithid benefactor.
Yet we were saved. Boo still draws breath - and so the mind flayer may continue to do so.
At least we draw breath still, thanks to the Emperor.
|At least we're not dead.|
We've gone astray. Foolish to think the Emperor would lead us to anything but ruin.
We have another option - the orb. I could still put a stop to this... though at great cost.
Honestly? I think putting trust in anyone but ourselves is foolhardy at this stage. One way or another, I think we amount to the best chance of stopping this.
If that is your wish, so be it... but the orb remains an option. And I shall not hesitate, if called upon.
But do not forget my sacred mission. Vlaakith demands we sever the prince's blasphemous head.
The Emperor's plan failed - we need to come up with our own plan.
I guarantee that Vlaakith's kith'raki will fly to our aid. The lich queen will not abandon me in my moment of need.
Let that be our backup plan's backup plan. We need you, beardy. Un-exploded.
My hamster is not in the habit of choosing between two evils. We will find a third and better way, or Boo will know the reason why!
Surely we're not there yet? There must still be options that don't include exploding.
No, we cannot resort to that - not if there's even a glimmer of hope remaining. If we're willing to sacrifice a whole city of innocents, what are we even fighting for?
And I thought myself the pragmatist. No, Gale - better to die for the right choice than live with the wrong one.
Do you expect the Emperor will just let Orpheus walk free?
We have another option - the orb. I could still put a stop to this... though at great cost.
The Emperor's plan only failed because the brain has evolved - it might have another plan.
*And then there's the fire in your chest, filling you with white, hot, power, ready to be released at any moment.*
The Emperor's plan failed. It's proven it can't be trusted.
Speak to the Emperor if you must. But it will cajole you with empty promises, coax you with lies. There is only one answer it deserves:
... the orb. I still have the means to unleash its power, and put a stop to all this from one heartbeat to the next. But it would not be without cost. The city, and all who remain, would be lost.
My fate unravels, and you're concerned with my tone? Fagh wo'h chox, kainyank!

EditorData.NodeContext: fahg woh CHALKS, cane-yank! (Fuck off, cursed one!)

Text.Value: No - I won't accept this. This cannot be the path's end!
What's next? There's got to be something.
Well... I'm open to suggestions.
Where in the hells does that leave us?
None of you look particularly well - but not dead yet, either. This fight is not done.
Even Boo cannot formulate a strategy. Is this the end?
There must be a way. This cannot be the end.
But the fight is not over, not yet. There has to be another way.
|But we're nut dead, so that means the show isn't over.|

EditorData.logicalname: 1 ROLE A: 1: WHAT IS HAPPENING & 3: HOPE

Text.Value: I think we should free Orpheus - perhaps he can help us where the Emperor failed.
Whatever comes next, choose wisely. What's done cannot be undone.
Let's get this over with.
Probably wise to not trust that thing... but we're not exactly inundated with alternatives. Whatever we do, it had better count.
All right, but we'd better make our next move a good one. Otherwise it will be our last.
We need not speak of trust. Only using the creature as it no doubt means to use us.
|Then we'll need to make our next move carefully. While my option is available, I'm not eager to using it if it can be avoided.|
Damn these stones. We did not come this far, spilled so much blood, just for them to fail us.
Those fucking stones were worthless.
So much for those stones. How're we supposed defeat a Netherbrain?
After everything we went through to get those stones, they didn't even work? Because now it's a 'nethersomething'?
So now it is a Netherbrain we face - and it seems disinclined to yield to the Netherstones.
I do not know what a Netherbrain is - but these Netherstones would have been more useful fashioned into a nether-club.
The stones have failed us. What in nature's realm could possibly best a Netherbrain?
The stones have failed us. The illithid has failed us. Our foe's strength supercedes them all.
|Well, that didn't work.|

EditorData.logicalname: 1 ROLE A: 1: WHAT IS HAPPENING & 3: HOPE

Text.Value: Let's hear what the Emperor has to say - we can make our minds up then.
Killing Orpheus could have disastrous consequences.
A githyanki who might turn on us for being infected? That is not someone I'm eager to pin my hopes on.
The Prince of the Comet will reclaim the throne from the traitorous lich queen.
Either way, I think we should free Orpheus.
The Emperor has been manipulating us this whole time - it's proven it can't be trusted.
Abandon this fruitless ghaik alliance.
The end is nigh, one way or another, and our options are dwindling in both quantity and quality.
Whatever helps us defeat the Netherbrain, I'm open to it.
That's not our only option - we could still free Orpheus.
We're closer than we've ever been to finishing this thing. And we got here with the Emperor's help.
The illithid lied about the nether-pebbles, but... Boo would not still draw breath without it.
At least it has a plan. I don't see you suggesting anything.
We could at least hear the Emperor's words first - that does not oblige us to heed them.
I have no love for the illithid - but its survival is bound to ours. That is as close to common cause as we will get.
Now we free Orpheus. Perhaps he can help us succeed where the Emperor failed.
I say we free Orpheus. Perhaps he can help us where the Emperor failed.
I will not sacrifice this city just so you can die a martyr. We will find another way.
No way, beardy. We need you alive. And we need me alive too. We need all of us alive.
The city would be lost - and us along with it. That's a weak form of victory at best. There must be another way.
It's your orb, it's your choice. But I really hope it won't come to that.
A grim choice. But perhaps better than none at all, at the last.
My hamster is not in the habit of choosing between two evils. We will find a third and better way, or Boo will know the reason why!
If we sacrifice a whole city, we'd be little more than villains ourselves. There must be another way.
Then we find another option.
Whatever the ghaik proposes, we must have but one goal in mind: free Orpheus from his shackles.
We have no means of breaking Orpheus out. How will we kill him?

EditorData.logicalname: VLAAKITH PATH W/O HAMMER, knows of hammer

Text.Value: The Githyanki Empire is at a precipice - one wrong push, and it tumbles.
We've gone astray. Foolish to think the Emperor would lead us to anything but ruin.
The Emperor failed us. Its plan has all but led us to ruin.
The illithid lied about its nether-pebbles. Only say the word, and Minsc will feed them back to it.
The illithid has deceived us, and we have submitted like pups to the slaughter. No more.
Perhaps it's time we stop trusting the illithid to save us. Its manipulation has brought us nowhere.
The Emperor did this. Planned this, somehow. What's it hiding?
I made my promise. I will not fail Gith's son on the basis of groundless fears or fickle whims.
And what is that plan, exactly? What options do we have?
Our own plan. Right. Thing is I'm more of an enacter than a concocter.
Not much is coming to mind - at least nothing that's terribly appealing...
I just hope it's a good one - this could be our last shot.
I could stand to hear the details, if you have them. I do not think we have much time.
Find the brain's butt, and Minsc will kick it. That is a plan, yes?
Easier said than done, perhaps.
A plan? We need more than a plan.
|Easier said than done.|
You distrust the Emperor that much?

Synopsis:
The party discuss what just occurred and what to do about their current situation.They failed to kill the Netherbrain and the Emperor has other plans in mind. Gale and Lae'zel are given a higher priority here since Gale has the bomb in his chest and Lae'zel may want to free Orpheus.

The main topics:
1. What Is Happening
2.  Distrust
3. Hope
